paper_title.ja: サンダーソニアの開花および新塊茎の肥大に及ぼす毋塊茎の切断程度の影響
paper_title.en: Effects of Excision of Mother Tuber on Flowering and Growth of Daughter Tubers in Sandersonia (Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook.)

description.ja: サンダーソニアの母塊茎の切除程度が開花および新塊茎の肥大に及ぼす影響を検討した．葉数や草丈の増加は切除程度が大きいと劣り，同時に開花数は著しく少なくなった．発蕾日数および到花日数は切除程度が大きいと増加した．新塊茎の肥大のうち，新塊茎の長さは処理区間で差がみられなかったが，最大塊茎径は切除程度の小さいものほど大きい値を示した．新塊茎重は切除程度が小さいほど大きく，無処理で最も大となり，1/4残存区はその1/2の重さとなったが，肥大部除去と1/2残存区の新塊茎重は無処理区と大差が認められなかった．以上の結果，植え付け時における毋塊茎の切断は軽度であっても開花に悪影響を及ぼすが，新塊茎の肥大に関しては軽度の切断は許容されるものと考えられた．
description.en: Effects of the excision of mother tuber on flowering and growth of daughter tubers of Sandersonia aurantiaca plants were investigated. By large excision of the mother tuber, the numbers of leaves and stem elongation were retarded and the numbers of flowers were decreased. The number of days to flower budding and the number of days to flowering were increased by large excision of the mother tuber. The length of normal fingerlike or fork shaped daughter tubers was not affected by excision of the mother tuber. The maximum diameter of daughter tubers was larger when excision of the mother tuber was smaller. The fresh weight of daughter tubers was larger when excision of the mother tuber was smaller, and was the greatest without removal (control), intermediate at removal of the enlarged stem base, leaving 1/2 remaining, and the smallest when only 1/4 was left remaining. The fresh weight of daughter tubers at 1/4 remaining treatment was about 50% of the control. It was concluded that flowering of Sandersonia is adversely affected by slight excision of the mother tuber at planting, while slight excision of the mother tuber hardly affect enlargement of the daughter tubers.

publisher.ja: THE JAPANESE SOCIETY FOR HORTICULTURAL SCIENCE
publisher.en: THE JAPANESE SOCIETY FOR HORTICULTURAL SCIENCE

paper_title.ja: サンダーソニアの胚培養における子球形成ならびにカルス形成
paper_title.en: Formation of Small Tubers and Calli from Embryo Culture of Sandersonia (Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook)

description.ja:
サンダーソニア種子から摘出した胚の培養における子球形成ならびにカルス形成に及ぼす光条件（明・暗）と植物ホルモン（BA，NAA）の影響について検討した．
胚からの子球形成は明条件，ホルモン無添加の区で優れ，次いで低濃度のNAA およびBA 添加区で認められた．胚からのカルス形成は明条件下では認められず，暗条件下で認められ，不定根組織由来のカルスが高濃度のBA 添加のBA 1.0 mgl-1区，NAA 0.1 mgl-1＋BA 1.0 mgl-1区，NAA 0.1 mgl-1＋BA 5.0 mgl-1区において多く認められた．
description.en:
The effects of culture medium composition and light condition on tuber formation and callus formation were examined in the culture of embryos excised from Sandersonia seed.
The growth of embryos was observed under hormone-free and dark conditions, and the formation of new small tubers from the embryo was promoted by hormone-free growth under light conditions.
No callus formation from the embryo was observed under light conditions; however, callus formation from adventitious root tissue was observed under dark conditions on media containing NAA 0.1 mgl-1 + BA 1.0 mgl-1and NAA 0.1 mgl-1 + BA 5.0 mgl-1.

publisher.en: Japanese Society of Agricultural, Biological and Environmental Engineers and Scientists

paper_title.ja: Effects of different diurnal temmperature on the growth of sandersonia(Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook.) plants.
paper_title.en: Effects of Different Diurnal Temperatures on the Growth of Sandersonia (Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook.) Plants

description.ja: 昼/夜の温度を高温(30/24℃), 中温(24/17℃)および低温(17/12℃)に調節してサンダーソニア(Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook.)の生育を調査した.茎の伸長, 葉数の増加および分枝の発生は高温で促進され, 低温で抑制された.中温では茎の伸長, 葉数の増加および分枝の発生が高温と低温の中間を示した.開花数は中温および低温で少なく, 高温で多かった.茎葉の枯れ上がり時の新塊茎の新鮮重と乾物重は中温で最も重く, 次いで高温で重く, 低温では最も小さかった.新塊茎の形状は中温および低温で二又の指状球根であったが, 高温では新塊茎の生長点部に球状の二次球根が多く形成された.以上の結果, サンダーソニアの塊茎の形成・肥大には中温が適しているものと考えられた.
description.en: Effects of day and night temperatures on the growth and the tuber formation of Sandersonia aurantiaca plants were investigated. Seedlings with 1 or 2 leaves were transferred to growth chambers, controlled at day/night temperatures of 17/12℃, 24/17℃, and 30/24℃ under natural daylength. On plants kept at 30/24℃, the unfolding of leaves, stem elongation, and the branching from the main stem were enhanced, whereas those at 17/12℃ were retarded. At 24/17℃, intermediate vegetative growth and optimum growth for flower stalk elongation and flowering were educed. At the time of shoot die back, the fresh and dry weights of new tubers were greatest at 24/17℃, moderate at 30/24℃, and smallest at 17/12℃. At 17/12℃ and 24/17℃, normal fingerlike or fork shaped tubers developed, while at 30/24℃, secondary tubers formed and developed. These results indicate that 24/17℃ is optimum for tuber and flower development of sandersonia plants.

publisher.en: THE JAPANESE SOCIETY FOR HORTICULTURAL SCIENCE

publication_name.en: Journal of the Japanese Society for Horticultural Science

description.ja: 昼/夜の温度を高温(30/24℃), 中温(24/17℃)および低温(17/12℃)に調節してサンダーソニア(Sandersonia aurantiaca Hook.)の生育を調査した.茎の伸長, 葉数の増加および分枝の発生は高温で促進され, 低温で抑制された.中温では茎の伸長, 葉数の増加および分枝の発生が高温と低温の中間を示した.開花数は中温および低温で少なく, 高温で多かった.茎葉の枯れ上がり時の新塊茎の新鮮重と乾物重は中温で最も重く, 次いで高温で重く, 低温では最も小さかった.新塊茎の形状は中温および低温で二又の指状球根であったが, 高温では新塊茎の生長点部に球状の二次球根が多く形成された.以上の結果, サンダーソニアの塊茎の形成・肥大には中温が適しているものと考えられた.
description.en: Effects of day and night temperatures on the growth and the tuber formation of Sandersonia aurantiaca plants were investigated. Seedlings with 1 or 2 leaves were transferred to growth chambers, controlled at day/night temperatures of 17/12℃, 24/17℃, and 30/24℃ under natural daylength. On plants kept at 30/24℃, the unfolding of leaves, stem elongation, and the branching from the main stem were enhanced, whereas those at 17/12℃ were retarded. At 24/17℃, intermediate vegetative growth and optimum growth for flower stalk elongation and flowering were educed. At the time of shoot die back, the fresh and dry weights of new tubers were greatest at 24/17℃, moderate at 30/24℃, and smallest at 17/12℃. At 17/12℃ and 24/17℃, normal fingerlike or fork shaped tubers developed, while at 30/24℃, secondary tubers formed and developed. These results indicate that 24/17℃ is optimum for tuber and flower development of sandersonia plants.

paper_title.en: Effect of ambient temperature on the growth and development of amaryllis (Hippeastrum hybridum hort.) bulbs

description.en:
How different day/night temperature affect the growth and development of the vegetative and reproductive parts, including the bulbs of amaryllis (Hippeastrum hybridum) plants in growth chambers for two years was investigated. One-year-old, 2-leafed seedlings were transferred to growth chambers set at 17 degrees/12 degrees C(low, L plot), 24 degrees/17 degrees C (middle, M plot) and 30 degrees/24 degrees C (high, H plot) under natural daylength.
1. High temperatures (H plot) hastened the unfolding and elongation of leaves, and increased markedly the growth of mother bulb and daughter bulbs,but the plants did not flower.
2. In plants exposed to low temperature (L plot), the leaves wore the slowest of the three plots to unfold and elongate; the mother bulbs were slow to enlarge but produced the most daughter bulbs. The temperature favored floral development.
3. Middle temperature (M plot) educed intermediate vegetative growth and the enlargement of mother and daughter bulbs. This condition was optimum for flower stalk elongation and flowering.
Thus, comparing the responses of amaryllis grown under low, middle, and high day/night temperatures, high temperature favored promotion of mother bulb enlargement, but the moderate and low temperatures were optimum for bulb and flower production.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE JAPANESE SOCIETY FOR HORTICULTURAL SCIENCE

paper_title.ja: サンダーソニアの胚培養における光条件とショ糖濃度の影響と,継代後の子球形成に及ぼすポリエチレングリコール(PEG)の影響
塊茎の分割程度がサンダーソニアの開花及び球の形成・肥大に及ぼす影響
生育温度がアマリリス球根の形成・肥大に及ぼす影響
paper_title.en: Effect of Ambient Temperature on the Growth and Development of Amaryllis(Hippeastrum hybridum horb. ) Bulbs.

description.ja:
生育温度[高温:30°C (昼温) /24°C (夜温), 中温 (24°/17°C) および低温 (17°/12°C) ]がアマリリス (Hippeastrum hybridum hort.) の鱗茎形成•肥大ならびに各部位の発育に及ぼす影響を調査した.
高温では開花が抑制されたが, 葉の生育は促進され,鱗茎および子球の肥大も促された. 一方, 低温では開花が見られ, また子球の形成が促進されたが, 葉の生育および隣茎の肥大は抑制された. 中温では地上部および地下部ともに高温と低温の中間の生育を示した.
以上の結果, アマリリスでは高温条件が球の肥大を促すものと考えられた.
description.en:
How different day/night temperature affect the growth and development of the vegetative and reproductive parts, including the bulbs of amaryllis (Hippeastrum hybridum) plants in growth chambers for two years was investigated. One-year-old, 2-leafed seedlings were transferred to growth chambers set at 17 °/12°C (low, L plot), 24°/17°C (middle, M plot) and 30/24°C (high, H plot) under natural daylength.
1. High temperatures (H plot) hastened the unfolding and elongation of leaves, and increased markedly the growth of mother bulb and daughter bulbs, but the plants did not flower.
2. In plants exposed to low temperature (L plot), the leaves were the slowest of the three plots to unfold and elongate; the mother bulbs were slow to enlarge but produced the most daughter bulbs. The temperature favored floral development.
3. Middle temperature (M plot) educed intermediate vegetative growth and the enlargement of mother and daughter bulbs. This condition was optimum for flower stalk elongation and flowering.
Thus, comparing the responses of amaryllis grown under low, middle, and high day/night temperatures, high temperature favored promotion of mother bulb enlargement, but the moderate and low temperatures were optimum for bulb and flower production.
